2020

Xenosiderophore utilization promotes Bacteroides thetaiotaomicron resilience during colitis

Zhu W, Winter MG, Spiga L, Hughes ER, Chanin R, Mulgaonkar A, Pennington J, Maas M, Behrendt CL, Kim J, Sun X, Beiting DP, Hooper LV, Winter S Cell Host Microbe. Manuscript accepted

The parasite kinase ROP16 is a key virulence factor that acts in cis and trans and mediates suppression of T cell responses

Chen L*, Christian DA*, Kochanowsky JA, Phan AT, Clark J, Wang S, Berry C, Oh J, Chen X, Roos DS, Beiting DP, Koshy AA, Hunter CA Journal of Experimental Medicine. in press

2019

OHMI: The Ontology of Host-Microbiome Interactions

He Y, Wang H, Zheng J, Beiting DP, Masci AM, Yu H, Curtis JL, Smith B, Alekseyenko AV, Obeid JS
- Introduces a structured language for describing interactions between microbes and their hosts.
- You can access the OHMI ontology on the OBO Foundry, or on Github
- OHMI is actively being updated and currently contains 1244 terms, including 1025 classes and 128 object properties
Journal of Biomedical Semantics. Dec 30; 2019

Variable gene expression and parasite load predict treatment outcome in cutaneous leishmaniasis

Amorim CF, Novais FO, Nguyen B, Misic AM, Carvalho LP, Carvalho EM, Beiting DP*, Scott P* (asterisk denotes co-corresponding authors)
- We used a 'dual-transcriptome' approach to simultaneously measure host and parasite transcripts from the same skin samples of patients with cutaneous leishmaniasis.
- First study of this disease to incorporate clinical metadata from patients, and used a simple variability analysis to identify biomarkers of treatment outcome.
- We're now using these biomarkers to develop rapid diagnostic assays that could be used in Brazil for identifying patients at risk for failing convential therapy for this disease.
- Covered by PennToday News
- All code and figures are reproduced in this Rmarkdown document, and fully reproducilbe workflow is available as a code capsule on CodeOcean
Science Translational Medicine. Nov 20; 2019

Lifecycle progression and sexual development of the apicomplexan parasite Cryptosporidium parvum

Tandel J, English ED, Sateriale A, Gullicksrud JA, Beiting DP, Sullivan MC, Pinkston B, Striepen B
- Impressive work by the Striepen lab to create transgenic parasites that would allow isolation of specific developmental stages for evaluation by RNAseq.
- We used low-input RNAseq methods to sequence infected cells sorted based on these reporter parasites. A major challenge in this study was that only 0.5-3% of sequence reads were from parasites, while the rest was from the host cell.
- Despite these challenges, we were able to define the transcriptome of this important pathogen and identify stage and sex specific gene expression programs.
- All code and figures are reproduced in this Rmarkdown document, and fully reproducilbe workflow is available as a code capsule on CodeOcean
Nature Microbiology. Sept 02; 2019

Diet-induced remission in chronic enteropathy is associated with altered microbial community structure and synthesis of secondary bile acids

Wang S, Martins R, Sullivan MC, Friedman ES, Misic AM, El-Fahmawi A, De Martinis ECP, O’Brien K, Chen Y, Bradley C, Zhang G, Berry ASF, Hunter CA, Baldassano RN, Rondeau MP, Beiting DP
- The culmination of a 5yr clinical trial recruiting client-owned dogs that spontaneous developed an IBD-like disease. We combined longitudinal monitoring of the fecal microbiome and metabolome in dogs receiving different treatment modalities.
- We idenified Clostridium hiranonis, a known producer of secondary bile acids, as a key organism associated with diet-induced remission, and we showed that this organism reduced GI disease in a mouse model of colitis.
- The canine clinical trial leading to this work was part of this piece in Science, and was more recently covered by PennToday News
- A fully reproducilbe workflow, complete with all software and code, is availabe as a code capsule on CodeOcean
Microbiome. Aug 31; 2019

Gut microbiota features associated with Clostridioides difficile colonization in puppies

Berry ASF, Kelly BJ, Barnhart D, Kelly DJ, Beiting DP, Baldassano RN, Redding LE PLOS One. Aug 30; 2019

Fibroblast activation protein restrains adipogenic differentiation and regulats matrix-mediated mTOR signaling

Puré E, Beiting DP, Wabitsch M, Blomberg R, Matrix Biology. July 17; 2019

Infection-Induced Intestinal Dysbiosis Is Mediated by Macrophage Activation and Nitrate Production

Wang S, El-Fahmawi A, Christian DA, Fang Q, Radaelli E, Chen L, Sullivan MC, Misic AM, Ellringer JA, Zhu XQ, Winter SE, Hunter CA*, Beiting DP* (asterisk denotes co-corresponding authors)
- Oral infection with Toxoplasma gondii leads to a profound dysbiosis in the small intestine of C57BL6 mice, ultimately leading to sepsis and death within two weeks of infection. Working together with Chris Hunter's lab and Sebastian Winter's lab, we investigated the immune and microbial basis for this phenomenon.
- This study also shows that this dysbiosis is driven by STAT1 activation in myeloid cells -> iNOS activation -> nitric oxide production -> nitrates -> expansion of gammaproteobacteria.
- Highlights that the potent Th1 effector mechanisms that are characteristic of protozoan parasite infections can dramatically alter the gut microbiome.
MBio. May 28; 2019

IL-27 and TCR Stimulation Promote T Cell Expression of Multiple Inhibitory Receptors

DeLong JH, O’Hara Hall A, Rausch M, Moodley D, Perry J, Park J, Phan AT, Beiting DP, Kedl RM, Hill JA, Hunter CA ImmunoHorizons. Jan 01; 2019

Glycolysis is important for optimal asexual growth and formation of mature tissue cysts by Toxoplasma gondii

Shukla A, Olszewski KL, Llinás M, Rommereim LM, Fox BA, Bzik DJ, Xia D, Wastling J, Beiting D, Roos DS, Shanmugam D International journal for parasitology. Aug 31; 2018

Sex-specific gene expression differences are evident in human embryonic stem cells and during in vitro differentiation of human placental progenitor cells

Syrett C, Sierra I, Berry C, Beiting DP, Anguera M Stem Cells and Development. July 11; 2018

The maternal vaginal microbiome partially mediates the effects of prenatal stress on offspring gut and hypothalamus.

Jasarevic E, Howard CD, Morrison KE, Misic AM, Weinkopff T, Scott P, Hunter CA, Beiting DP, Bale TL Nature Neuroscience. July 9; 2018

Culture-independent profiling of the stool microbiome to identify microbial species associated with a diarrheal outbreak in an immunocompromised mouse colony.

Misic AM, Miedel EL, Brice AK, Cole S, Zhang GF, Dyer CD, Secreto A, Smith AL, Danet-Desnoyers G, Beiting DP
- This case study was a collaboration with the University Lab Animal Resources (ULAR) at Penn.
- The goal was to see if microbiome profiling methods could shed some light on potential causes of a devastating diarrheal disease outbreak that occured in a colony of NSG mice.
- We also used this opportunity to test the ability of cosmosID to rapidly and accurately identify potential causes of an outbreak.
Comparative Medicine. June 13; 2018

Commensal microbes induce serum IgA responses that protect against polymicrobial sepsis.

Wilmore JR, Gaudette BT, Gomez Atria D, Hashemi T, Jones DD, Gardner CA, Cole SD, Misic A, Beiting DP, Allman D Cell Host Microbe. Feb 22; 2018

CD8+ T cells lack local signals to produce IFN-γ in the skin during leishmania infection.

Novais FO, Wong AC, Villarea DO, Beiting DP, Scott P Journal of Immunology. Jan 24; 2018

MicrobiomeDB: a systems biology platform for integrating, mining and analyzing microbiome experiments

Oliveira F, Brestelli J, Cade S, Zheng J, Iodice J, Fisher S, Aurrecoechea C, Kissinger JC, Brunk BP, Stoeckert Jr., CJ, Fernandes GR, Roos DS*, Beiting DP* (asterisk denotes co-corresponding authors)
- We teamed up with David Roos' group and leveraged their fantastic web toolkit currently used for mining eukaryotic pathogen genomes, to interrogate 16S rRNA microbiome datasets in the public domain.
- This is the first microbiome database resource to combine curated and harmonized sample metadata with data visualization tools.
- This database is freely available at microbiomeDB.org and currently contains data for nearly 20,000 samples. Covered by PennToday News
- Video tutorials, Github site for microbiomeDB, R scripts for our data viz apps, our data loading workflow, metadata text files for each study
Nucleic Acids Research. Jan 4; 2018

STAT1 signaling in astrocytes is essential for control of Toxoplasma gondii in the central nervous system.

Hidano S, Randall LM, Dawson L, Dietrich HK, Konradt C, Klover PJ, John B, Harris TH, Fang Q, Turek B, Kobayashi T, Hennighausen L, Beiting DP, Koshy A, Hunter CA MBio. Nov 8; 2016

Activity of uncleaved caspase-8 controls anti-bacterial immune defense and TLR-induced cytokine production independent of cell death.

Philip NH, DeLaney A, Santos-Marerro M, Grier J, Sun Y, Wynosky-Dolfi M, Peterson L, Zwack EE, Hu B, Olson TM, Rongvaux A, Pope SD, Lopez CB, Oberst A, Beiting DP, Henao-Mejia J, Brodsky IE PLOS Pathogens. Oct 13; 2016

Divergent isoprenoid biosynthesis pathways in Staphylococcus species constitute a drug target for treating infections in companion animals.

Misic A, Cain C, Morris DO, Rankin S, Beiting DP
- This was a great collaboration with the Clinical Microbiology and Dermatology labs at PennVet, with the goal of using genome sequencing and comparative genomics to understand canine Staphylococcus infections.
- We used PacBio sequencing to generate a closed genome for Staphylococcus schleiferi, and compared this sequencing with publicly available sequences from Staph species isolated from humans and animals.
- Suprisingly, we found that S. schleiferi – and most other Staph species associated with infections in vet med – use the non-mevalonate pathway for isoprenoid biosynthesis, while S. aureus and other Staph species associated with infections of humans and non-human primates use the mevalonate pathway.
- This surprising finidng not only raises the possibility of targeting the non-mevalonate pathway for treating Staph infections in vet med, but also highlights that isoprenoid biosynthesis pathway usage could play a role in host range determination for Staph
mSphere. Sept 28; 2016

Meta-transcriptome profiling of the human-Leishmania braziliensis cutaneous lesion.

Christensen S, Dillon LAL, Carvalho LP, Passos S, Novais F, Hughitt K, Beiting DP, Carvalho EM, Scott P, El-Sayed NM and Mosser DM PLOS Neglected Tropical Diseases. Sept 15; 2016
